STATIC_text.text: The ovaries are two small glands located in the lower abdominal region of the female. The ovaries produce the female gamete, the ovum, as well as hormones that are responsible for female sex characteristics and regulation of the menstrual cycle.

The ovarian hormones are estrogens (estradiol and estrone) and progesterone. Estrogens stimulate development of ova (eggs) and development of female secondary sex characteristics. Progesterone is responsible for the preparation and maintenance of the uterus in pregnancy.
